newsitem.title: CANADA: CBRS confirms PanCanadian credit ratings.
newsitem.headline: CBRS confirms PanCanadian credit ratings.

text.p: Canadian Bond Rating Service said on Wednesday it confirmed its high-quality credit ratings of A-1 and A+ on PanCanadian Petroleum Ltd's outstanding short- and long-term debt with a positive outlook.
CBRS said the positive rating outlook was reaffirmed because of PanCanadian's superior operating characteristics, financial flexibility and the expectation of continued improvement in the near term.
The A-1 and A+ ratings are applicable to the company's C$500-million commercial paper program and medium-term notes and long-term debentures, respectively, CBRS said.

It said PanCanadian, the highest rated company in CBRS's Canadian oil and gas producer group, extended its strong record of production growth of conventional oil, natural gas liquids and natural gas in the first nine months of this year.

The high volumes, combined with previously acquired income tax losses, enabled it to generate strong earnings and cash flow, despite revenue losses from commodity hedging and a C$30-million charge on discontinued Netherlands operations, it said.
However, CBRS said a continued aggressive level of capital spending has pushed debt leverage to the upper limits of the range for the current rating category, which is 25 to 30 percent.
